column4: coldtoast: I would really, really recomend you get a fat32 partition if you need to write data that needs to be accessible in windows. Either that or get an ext* driver for windows.

chihork: initrd will probably not load alsa drivers. The main purpous of the initrd is to load device driver required to mount the real root file system. ie if you've got SCSI drivers that need to be loaded because your / is on a SCSI disk.
chihork: alsa is loaded very much later than this.
then I can rule this one out.  Thanks again.
chihork: Now what was the trouble with alsa again? Which sound card and so on?
Thanks. I was not aware of that.

CS4281 : Crystal Sound Fusion.  I'm trying to use the low-latency pre-emptible patch, along with a custom-configuration for my kernel.  My sound card worked fine with the kernel provided, but after installing the new kernel, it doesn't work.  I think I'm messing up the IRQ sharing somewheres.
Well with the wide variety of filesystems that are availible it is a sound way to keep the kernel size down to a minimum.
chihork: Are you compiling the driver as a module?
the preemptible one, or the Alsa one?  ALSA is definitely a module.
chihork: Is it loaded?
sndcore is listed in lsmod, as well as snd-cs4281, so I think I can safely say, yes.
chihork: I see. Well then I'm all out of ideas. Perhaps compile support into the kernel instead of putting it in as a module? Might help.
but cat /proc/asound/cards gives "---no soundcards---"
Isn't initrd unloaded from memory after it's done with?
chihork: and you can mount  your initrd with mount -o loop. You might have to run gunzup on it first if it's packed with gzip.
chihork: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Initrd
yes, I am experimenting with a few ideas.  I'll add that one to the list :).  Thanks for the help.  Ahh, I think I'll check that out.  Initrd is like a blackbox to me right now.  Thanks again.
Ahh, yes. That's a valid point. I didn't even concider that.
chihork: initrd is _supposed_ to be a black box. :)
I see :) well, that could be a problem.  As soon as I figure out I don't need it for sure, I'm sure I'll be rid of it.
